meanings.definition: Stayed longer than intended; delayed in leaving.
meanings.sent1: She tarried at the park, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The train tarried at the station for an extra hour.
meanings.sent3: He tarried at the store, unable to decide which ice cream flavor to buy.
meanings.sent4: Time tarried like a slow turtle on that rainy afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her smile tarried in his mind long after she had left.

meanings.definition: To remain or stay in a place.
meanings.sent1: The cat tarried by the window, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent2: I tarried in the garden, enjoying the scent of the flowers.
meanings.sent3: The old man tarried on the bench, feeding breadcrumbs to the pigeons.
meanings.sent4: Hope tarried in her heart, refusing to fade away.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread tarried in the kitchen, inviting everyone to stay.
